title: Drawing, "Rough Sketch of Rainbows in the Spray", 1856
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on light-green wove paper.
markings: Recto: Stamped in black ink lower left: Museum for the Arts of Decoration Cooper Union [Lugt 457c]
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at bottom left:  Where the water washes the rock the color / is a lightish yellowish brown warm.  / Dry rock, grey and blackish, but warm.
description: A view of the Canadian Falls is shown from the bottom of Goat Island, near the water line. Large rocks dominate the foreground and Terrapin Tower is visible at top left above the falls. On the verso of the sheet is a sketch of rainbows in the spray.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Rough Sketch of Rainbows in the Spray", 1856.
1856. Graphite, brush and white gouache on light-green wove paper.. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-34-a.
